title: Question 25
prompt: ____________________. Their sense of smell is 2,100 times stronger than a human. This is primarily due to the part of the brain that controls smell, the olfactory bulb. This area is five times larger than the same area in a human's brain.
description: Read the paragraph. Then choose the sentence that best fills the blank in the paragraph.
feedback: The paragraph is about the ability of bears to smell. It explains how much stronger their sense of smell is than human smell, and it explains that the olfactory bulb in the brain is five times larger than the area in a human brain. The best introductory sentence introduces the same topic: “Bears are believed to have the strongest sense of smell of any animal on earth.” The incorrect responses mention that bears are strong, that bears leave behind their scent, and that humans should not leave food where bears might get it. These ideas aren’t related to the rest of the paragraph.
